page.title: 02Principle Features
page.content: {King's Worthy}is a large{village}of about 2000 people, with many old thatched buildings of flint and brick. It is 3 miles from Winchester in the Itchen valley, famed for its chalkbed river fishing, surrounded by dairy and arable farmland. It is situated on the old Pilgrim's Way near the London/ Winchester A33 Trunk Road, now superceded by the M3 and the A34 South Coast/Midlands Trunk Road. The village has now grown, with many new houses. There is a 14th century church, St. Mary's and a Methodist Chapel. King's Worthy County Primary School has 336 children and 10 teachers. There are 2 children homes, 2 homes for mentally handicapped children and 2 for the old. It is a dormitory area for Winchester with farming,some light industry and the H.Q of a major civil engineering company.
